She mentions that she feels relaxed being around protag but apologizes for giving him the wrong idea. The guys that bully protag confront him about being friends with a girl that has that reputation, and protag decides to grow a pair and starts a fight with them to defend her. She asks him about his injuries but he tells her that he was the one that threw the first punch (I don't think he tells her *why* he did it). She decides to make him a "real" man by having sex with him. Protag afterwards says that since she doesn't want any relationships, he asks if they can be friends. She counters by saying that friends don't have sex, but he's okay with that. Last page is him offering to give some of his not-PreCure merch to her little sister, which she accepts. Last text bubbles are her saying that it might be okay for friends to have sex every once in a while, him saying she just told him friends "don't* have sex, then her telling him he's getting cheeky and to get a haircut.

@Coffedrug: Okay, question - Does this mean that if someone else were to translate it, it'd get taken down? | And if works are getting kidnapped, I can spoil the hell out of this. Basically dude is getting bullied because he likes a children's anime (not-PreCure). Girl thinks he's gonna commit suicide and she noticed his not-PreCure cell phone strap. He thinks she's gonna make fun of him but she reveals she sort of likes it because her little sister is really into it. She also tells him his getting bullied isn't a big deal, since she's been through worse, but before she elaborates has to run to pick up her little sister (she asks to borrow $20 from him). They become friendly after that, but when he tries to get together with her but she tells him she's not interested in a relationship. Because of money issues, she's prostituting herself and expect protag to hate her.

In the notes the author mentions that it was going to be a romantic story, but it turned out that way.
Also that if the story becomes popular he will make a continuation either as she dates the otaku or her days before meeting him.

The otaku gets angry and defends her leading to a fight.
The gal gets mad at that and before she does anything he stops her.
They move on to the hotel scene....
At the end they both talk about how their relationship will be.
The otaku says it's okay if they are at least friends.
The gal says it's fine, but friends don't have sex (thinking to herself that the guy will refuse).
To her surprise he is happy with the idea and that he got a friend (they talk that he should invite his sister to watch the anime together since he has dvd's of the series).
She tells him that he must change his appearance if they want to continue "playing".

In the final data it is mentioned that the gal is an orphan and together with her younger sister she is in the care of her uncle (who is implied to have abused her or overstepped his bounds) so they ran away from home.
In the end she began to prostitute herself to earn some money and buy things for her sister.

Sorry for the bad English, I'm using a translator.

The story is about an Otaku who suffers bullying with suicide attempts.
He meets the gal who stops him.
They talk and she mentions that there are worse things (she mentions that she still had a bad time).
At the end, she mentions that the keychain that the boy has is from a series that her younger sister likes and that they watched together.
When they say goodbye she asks him for money and gives him a little fanservice while encouraging him not to take his own life until he is with a woman.
From there they begin their erotic talks and games.
The otaku confesses to her and she rejects him saying that she is not a good girl (she prostitutes herself to buy things for her sister) and that it would not be good for him to get involved with her.
In the bathroom he meets two guys who ask him to tell him how much the gal charges to have equal sex.
The otaku gets angry and defends her leading to a fight.
